doc.field: Series I: Labor unions and organizations
Series I: Labor unions and organizations
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Labor Movement Serials
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Labor Movement Serials
Subseries I.I: Labor Coalitions and Organizations
Subseries I.I: Labor Coalitions and Organizations

This series collects uncataloged serials and newsletters published by a variety of labor coalitions, advocacy groups, research institutions, professional associations, and political organizations. Formed around common interest groups, a full range of labor causes are detailed in bulletins, newspapers, and circulars: the rights of women in the workplace (various publications issued by the Coalition of Labor Union Women and New York Women's Trade Union); benefit and pension updates for workers (Employee Benefits Digest; Labor News for Working Families; Westchester 60 Plus); and activism around unemployment and working conditions (newsletters issued by Jobs With Justice; Rhode Island Workers Association Organizing Center; and the Trade Union League). Issuing organizations range from large coalitions (Jewish Labor Committee; New York City Central Labor Council; Philadelphia Workers' Organizing Committee) to smaller bodies and rank and file groups providing information for workers exposed to asbestos (Abestos Update).
